intro: Tetracoilanthus, commonly known as the spiral-leaf plant, is a unique genus within the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that give it a visually striking appearance. The plant typically features compound leaves with a central stem and multiple leaflets radiating outward in a helical pattern. Tetracoilanthus species are native to tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
